1.text: Fill the vase with some hot water.

2.text: Toss in two Alka seltzer tablets.

4.text: Fill the vase with hot water until all stains are submerged.

5.text: Pour in a tablespoon of baking soda.

6.text: Pour in about five tablespoons of white vinegar.

7.text: Take around 1 tablespoon of salt and add vinegar until a paste forms.

8.text: Rub the paste on the residue with a washcloth.

9.text: Try leaving the paste on the spots for ten minutes, and then scrub with an old toothbrush or washcloth if stains are still there.

10.text: Boil, or at least warm an appropriate amount of heated vinegar based on the size of your vase.

11.text: Pour the vinegar into the vase and let soak for around 24 hours.

12.text: Scrub the stains with warm, soapy water.

13.text: Try using the method in step four in order to loosen the stains.

14.text: Crush eggshells into sizes small enough to fit through the neck of your vase.

15.text: Add in a bit of water.

16.text: Cover your hand over the opening and shake well.

17.text: Fill the vase with around 1/4 cup vinegar.

18.text: Add a couple tablespoons of sand depending on size.

19.text: Shake the vase thoroughly with your hand over the opening.
